department_name: Department of Economic Theory and Analysis

courses.name: Bachelor of Science in Economics
courses.description: This program provides a strong foundation in economic theory, quantitative methods, and applied economics for analyzing economic issues and policy.

course_units.title: Principles of Microeconomics
course_units.description: Introduction to basic microeconomic concepts and principles.

course_units.title: Mathematics for Economists I
course_units.description: Mathematical tools and techniques used in economic analysis.

course_units.title: Introduction to Economic Statistics
course_units.description: Basic statistical concepts and methods for economic data analysis.

course_units.title: Principles of Macroeconomics
course_units.description: Introduction to basic macroeconomic concepts and principles.

course_units.title: Mathematics for Economists II
course_units.description: Advanced mathematical tools for economic analysis.

course_units.title: Economic History
course_units.description: Historical development of economic systems and thought.

course_units.title: Intermediate Microeconomics
course_units.description: Advanced analysis of consumer and producer behavior.

course_units.title: Econometrics I
course_units.description: Introduction to econometric methods and applications.

course_units.title: Public Economics
course_units.description: Economic analysis of government policies and public sector.

course_units.title: Intermediate Macroeconomics
course_units.description: Advanced analysis of aggregate economic activity.

course_units.title: Monetary Economics
course_units.description: Theory and practice of monetary policy and financial systems.

course_units.title: International Economics
course_units.description: Theory and policy of international trade and finance.

course_units.title: Economic Growth and Development
course_units.description: Theories and empirical evidence on economic development.

course_units.title: Research Methods in Economics
course_units.description: Research methodologies and empirical analysis in economics.

course_units.title: Labor Economics
course_units.description: Economic analysis of labor markets and employment.

course_units.title: Game Theory and Strategic Behavior
course_units.description: Analysis of strategic interaction and decision-making.
